Climate Change via visual storytelling

Climate change is not only about emissions, it touches every aspect of our lives and it has consequences for everyone but especially for people in countries who have least contributed to the problem.

These resources (or most of them) explain climate change through visual storytelling, either by using charts or scrollytelling or other data visualization techniques to explain the issues caused by climate change.

Warning

Reading the articles can be quite overwhelming. If you would feel hopeless after reading these, take care of yourself, maybe go to section "Social Action" or “Technology / Natural solutions” which has some solutions how we can tackle this, for example one of the articles ends with:
"Everyone [...] needs to know: We largely have the technology to solve the problem.
All we have to do is start."

"The world’s leading climate scientists have warned there is only a dozen years for global warming to be kept to a maximum of 1.5C, beyond which even half a degree will significantly worsen the risks of drought, floods, extreme heat and poverty for hundreds of millions of people."
